technical-data.invention-title: VERSTELLVORRICHTUNG FÜR VERDECKTE SCHARNIERE UND VERDECKTES SCHARNIER MIT DER VERSTELLVORRICHTUNG
ADJUSTMENT DEVICE FOR HIDDEN HINGES AND HIDDEN HINGE COMPRISING SAID ADJUSTMENT DEVICE
DISPOSITIF DE REGLAGE POUR CHARNIÈRE INVISIBLE ET CHARNIÈRE INVISIBLE COMPRENANT LEDIT DISPOSITIF DE REGLAGE

description.p: The present invention relates to an adjustment device for door leaf hinges and to a hinge, typically of hidden type, which comprises the adjustment device.
In particular, the present invention applies to hidden hinges for any type of door leaf, such as for instance conventional doors, armored doors, entrance doors or the like.

Known hidden hinges comprise a fixed portion, which is bound to a door frame, and a movable portion, which is turnably bound to the fixed portion and which can be connected to a door leaf to be moved. The movable portion rotates around the fixed portion around a hinge axis.
In particular, the movable portion comprises a bracket, which is firmly connected to the door leaf so as to couple the hinge and the door leaf together.

Known adjustment devices allow to position the door leaf with respect to the frame with the required accuracy. In particular, adjustment devices act by changing the position of the connecting bracket with respect to the remaining hinge.

Therefore, known adjustment devices act upon the connecting bracket by moving it with respect to the remaining movable portion of the hinge. Known devices thus comprise control members directly actuated by an operator, and connection means converting the operator's action into a bracket shift.

The control members of known devices comprise a pair of control screws arranged with mutually parallel axes on the movable portion of the hinge. In this case, the connection means comprise eccentric means directly controlled by the screws.

In other words, each screw is associated with an eccentric stud sliding in respective slots arranged perpendicularly to one another and obtained integrally with the connecting bracket, so as to control the latter to make two mutually orthogonal shifts. In general, the slots are arranged so as to let the door leaf move on its lying plane in a direction parallel to the hinge axis and in a direction transversal thereto.
Disadvantageously, known adjustment devices for hidden hinges are not characterized by a simple and intuitive use.

As a matter of fact, the use of eccentric means implies that control members lie side-by-side and parallel to one another. In order words, the adjustment of the door leaf position along the two perpendicular directions as mentioned occurs by actuating controls arranged mutually near each other and parallel to one another. Therefore, the adjustment direction associated with a specific control member cannot be immediately identified.

Moreover, a further drawback concerns adjustment accuracy. As a matter of fact, in case of eccentric connection means the maximum shift of the connecting bracket must be determined by a single 180° rotation of the screws. This makes correct determination of the adjustment inaccurate.

A further drawback of the prior art lies in the complex manufacturing of the components, e.g. eccentric elements, which results in high manufacturing costs. EP1091067A, US6715181B1, FR1422961A disclose prior-art adjustment devices for door leaf hinges. EP 1 602 794 discloses the features of the preamble of claim 1.

Under these circumstances, the technical task underlying the present invention consists in proposing an adjustment device for hinges, typically hidden hinges, and an hidden hinge comprising the adjustment device, which both overcome one or more of the drawbacks of the prior art as mentioned above.

In particular, an aim of the present invention consists in providing an adjustment device for hinges, typically hidden hinges, and a hinge, typically an hidden hinge, comprising the adjustment device, which can make adjustment operations easier and more intuitive.

One of the aims of the present invention consists in proposing an adjustment device for hinges, preferably hidden hinges, and an hidden hinge comprising the adjustment device, in which door leaf adjustment is more accurate.
One of the aims of the present invention consists in proposing an adjustment device for hinges, typically hidden hinges, which is easy and cheap to manufacture.

The technical task and one or more of the aims referred to above are substantially achieved by an adjustment device for door leaf hinges, typically for hidden hinges, and by a hinge, typically an hidden hinge, comprising the adjustment device, having the technical features disclosed in one or more of the appended claims.

With reference to the accompanying figures, the numeral 1 globally refers to an adjustment device for hidden hinges according to the present invention, whereas the numeral 2 globally refers to an hidden hinge equipped with the device 1.
The hidden hinge 2 comprises a fixed portion 3, which is fastened to a frame 4 of a door (shown schematically in the figure), and a movable portion 5 connected to a door leaf 6.

The movable portion 5 is connected to the fixed portion 3 so that it can rotate around a hinge axis "A". In further detail, the hinge 2 comprises a rotation stud 7 connecting the movable portion 5 to the fixed portion 3.

The fixed portion 3 preferably comprises two L-shaped folded elements 8, which are arranged parallel one to the other and stiffly bound to one another by means of an upright 3a, which can be seen sectioned in figures 1 and 2 and which is partially visible in Figure 3. Each folded element 8 has a respective hole 9 for firmly coupling the fixed portion 3 with the frame 4. Said upright 3a develops parallel to the hinge axis "A". Said folded elements 8 have each a tab 8a provided with a further through hole for housing the aforesaid stud 7.

The movable portion 5 comprises a supporting plate 10 intended to be stiffly fastened to the door leaf 6, e.g. by means of screws. Preferably, the supporting plate 10 has a plurality of holes 11 for coupling the movable portion 5 with the door leaf 6.
The movable portion 5 further comprises a body 12, preferably shaped as a plate at least partially folded for housing said stud 7. Such supporting plate 10 is associated with the body 12.

The adjustment device 1 is arranged on the movable portion 5 of the hinge 2, typically being a part of it. Advantageously, such device 1 mechanically connects the body 12 to the supporting plate 10, e.g. being placed therebetween.

According to the present invention, the adjustment device 1 comprises a first body 13 which can be mechanically associated with the body 12 of the movable portion 5 of the hinge 2 (typically the first body 13 can be stiffly bound to the body 12 of the movable portion 5), and a second body 14 which can be mechanically associated with the supporting plate 10 (typically the second body 14 can be stiffly bound to the door leaf 6).
By way of example, the first body 13 is made as one piece with the body 12. By way of example, the second body 14 is made as one piece with the supporting plate 10.

The first body 13 and the second body 14 are mechanically connected one to the other so that they are able to take stably a plurality of mutual positions. By way of example, the second body 14 is housed inside the first body 13.

The device 1 comprises at least a first 15 and a second control element 16, both associated with the first 13 and the second body 14 of the device 1 so as to determine the relative positions thereof, as will be more readily apparent from the following disclosure.

The device 1 advantageously comprises coupling means 17 acting between the first 15 and the second control element 16 and the second body 14 so as to cause respective shifts of the second body 14 with respect to the first body 13.

The coupling means 17 act between the first control element 15 and the second body 14 so as to enable a shift of the second body 14 with respect to the first body 13 along a first direction "D1" as a consequence of the activation of the first control element 15. Moreover, the coupling means 17 act between the second control element 16 and the second body 14 so as to enable a shift of the second body 14 with respect to the first body 13 along a second direction "D2" as a consequence of the activation of the second control element 16.

The first direction "D1" and the second direction "D2" are perpendicular to one another. Typically, the first "D1" and the second direction "D2" both lie on a lying plane of the door leaf 6, when the latter is coupled with the device 1. Advantageously, the first direction "D1" is parallel to the hinge axis "A", whereas the second direction "D2" is perpendicular to the hinge axis "A".
According to the present invention, the coupling means 17 are of the type with inclined planes.
The coupling means 17 with inclined planes involve the interaction of a first and a second element having respective inclined planes in mutual contact with one another.

Typically, the first element exerts a force on the second element according to a predefined direction. Force and movement transmission occurs where the contact between the respective inclined planes is. Thus, the direction of the force and/or movement acting upon the second element is transversal (i.e. non-parallel, typically orthogonal) to the predefined direction of the force of the first element.
The coupling means 17 with inclined planes comprise threaded means.

The first 15 and the second control element 16 comprise a first 18 and a second threaded screw 19, respectively, which are operatively located between the first 13 and the second body 14. The first 18 and the second screw 19 partially define the coupling means 17.

The second body 14 has at least a first 20 and a second hole 21, both internally threaded so as to house the first 18 and the second screw 19 accordingly. The first 20 and the second hole 21 partially define the coupling means 17.

By way of example, the first 18 and second screw 19 comprise a head 22 and a threaded shank 23, respectively. The head 22 is shaped so as to house a handling tool. By way of example, the head 22 is hexagonal or is a socket head (e.g. Allen screw).

Advantageously, the first 18 and the second screw 19 get through the first body 13 by means of respective non-threaded slots 24 and are screwed onto the second body 14 on the first 20 and the second hole 21. In particular, the heads 22 of the first 18 and of the second screw 19 remain in contact with a respective outer surface of the first body 13.

By way of exemplary reference to the figures, the first body 13 comprises a first wall 25, preferably a flat wall. Advantageously, the first wall 25 is made as one piece with the body 12 of the movable portion 5 of the hinge 2. Preferably, the first wall 25 lies perpendicular to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and parallel to the hinge axis "A".

The first body 13 comprises a second wall 26, preferably a flat wall, connected, preferably as one piece, to the first wall 25. The second wall 26 is arranged perpendicular to the first wall 25. The second wall 26 is arranged perpendicular to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and to the hinge axis "A".

In the disclosed embodiment, the first body 13 comprises an additional second wall 26' arranged, typically on the opposite side, parallel to the second wall 26 and similarly connected to the first wall 25 according to a plane of symmetry perpendicular to the hinge axis "A".

The first body 13 comprises a panel 27, preferably a flat panel. The panel 27 is connected, preferably as one piece, to the first 25 and the second wall 26. Preferably, the panel 27 is further connected to the additional second wall 26'. The panel 27 lies perpendicular both to the first and to the second wall. The panel 27 lies parallel to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and to the hinge axis "A".
The first wall 25, the second wall 26, the additional second wall 26', if present, and the panel 27 define a hollow 36 in which the second body 14 is arranged.

The second body 14 comprises a first wall 28, preferably a flat wall. Preferably the first wall 28 lies perpendicular to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and parallel to the hinge axis "A". The first wall 28 of the second body 14 lies facing and substantially parallel to the first wall 25 of the first body 13.

The second body 14 comprises a second wall 29, preferably a flat wall, connected, preferably as one piece, to the first wall 28. The second wall 29 is arranged perpendicular to the first wall 28. The second wall 29 is further preferably arranged perpendicular to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and to the hinge axis "A". The second wall 29 of the second body 14 lies facing and substantially parallel to the second wall 26 of the first body 13.

By way of example, the second body 14 comprises an additional second wall 29' arranged, typically on the opposite side, parallel to the second wall 29 and similarly connected to the first wall 28 according to a plane of symmetry perpendicular to the hinge axis "A". The additional second wall 29' of the second body 14 lies facing and substantially parallel to the additional second wall 26' of the first body 13.

Advantageously, the second body 14 comprises a panel 30, preferably a flat panel. The panel 30 is connected, preferably as one piece, to the first 28 and the second wall 29. Preferably, the panel 27 is further connected to the additional second wall 29'. The panel 30 lies perpendicular both to the first 28 and to the second wall 29. The panel 30 lies parallel to the lying plane of the door leaf 6 and to the hinge axis "A". The panel 30 of the second body 14 lies facing and substantially parallel to the panel 27 of the first body 13. In particular, the panel 27 of the first body 13 and the panel 30 of the second body 14 are always in mutual contact during operation.

The slots 24 are obtained at least on the first 25 and on the second wall 26 of the first body 13. Preferably, a slot 24 wholly identical to the slot 24 of the second wall 26 is obtained on the additional second wall 26' of the first body 13.

The first threaded hole 20 is obtained on the second wall 29 of the second body 14, whereas the second threaded hole 21 is obtained on the first wall 28 of the second body 14. An additional first threaded hole 20' can be obtained on the additional second wall 29' of the second body 14.

The supporting plate 10 is connected to the second wall 29 and to the panel 30 of the second body 14, if necessary also to the additional second wall 29'. Preferably, the supporting plate 10 is made as one piece with the second wall 29 and the panel 30 of the second body 14 (and with the additional second wall 29', if present).

As can be inferred from the configuration of the walls of the first 13 and of the second body 14, the first screw 18 is arranged with its longitudinal axis perpendicular to a longitudinal axis of the second screw 19. By way of example, the first screw 18 is arranged with its longitudinal axis parallel to said first direction "D1". The second screw 19 is arranged with its longitudinal axis parallel to said second direction "D2".

In use, once the hinge 2 is mounted and the door leaf 6 is connected to the supporting plate 10, the fine adjustment of the position of the door leaf 6 with respect to the frame 4 is carried out by actuating the first 18 and/or the second screw 19.

In further detail, when it is necessary to adjust the position of the door leaf 6 along the first direction "D1" as described, the operator should only act upon the first screw 18, which is oriented parallel to the said first direction "D1".

If it is necessary to adjust the position of the door leaf 6 along the second direction "D2" as described, conversely, the operator should only act upon the second screw 19, which is oriented parallel to said second direction "D2".

The device 1 further comprises blocking means 31 operating between the first 13 and the second body 14 so as to avoid relative movements between the two bodies, once the relative position has been obtained on the basis of the required adjustment.

By way of example, the blocking means 31 comprise a bolt 32 getting through an additional slot 33 obtained in the panel 27 of the first body 13, and screwed into a threaded opening 34 obtained in the panel 30 of the second body 14.

In order to activate the blocking means 31 after executing the adjustment, it is necessary only to tighten the bolt 32 so that the panel 27 of the first body 13 remains firmly in contact with the panel 30 of the second body 14, thanks to the presence of the bolt 32 head which remains in contact with an outer surface of the body 13.

Advantageously, the first screw 18 and/or the second screw 19 have a collar 35. By way of example, the collar 35 is arranged around the respective shank 23 and protrudes radially from the latter. Advantageously, the collar 35 lies near the head 22 at a slightly greater distance from the latter than the thickness of the walls 25 and/or 26 (thus, during operation, the wall 25 or 26 lies between the head 22 and said collar). This collar 35 is physically arranged between the first 13 and the second body 14. Advantageously, the collar 35 is made as one piece with the screw, as shown in the figure. In an alternative embodiment, which is not shown in the figure, the collar can consist of an open elastic (e.g. metal) ring, such as e.g. a Seeger ring, fitted into a groove on the screw shank.
Preferably, this collar 35 is at least on the second screw 19.

If the blocking means 31 are inactive, the weight of the door leaf 6 weighs on the body 12 of the hinge 2 through the second body 14 of the device 1. In this case, if the second body 14 imparts an axial action to the second screw 19 with a direction from the shank 23 to the head 22 (e.g. if the corresponding hinge 2 is the lowest hinge of a pair of hinges 2), the collar 35 abuts against the first wall 25 of the first body 13 opposing this axial action of the door leaf. Thus, a misalignment of the door leaf 6 can be prevented and an effective adjustment thereof is allowed.
The slots 24 and 33 on the first body 13 are shaped so as to enable the relative movement of the respective bolt 18, 19 or 32 (integral with the second body 14) with respect to the first body 13.

Advantageously, the slot 24 of the first wall 25 has an operating portion 24a with a smaller width than the collar 35 so as to enable the passage of the threaded shank 23, but in order to interfere with the collar 35 so as to prevent the second screw 19 from sliding and at least an insertion portion 24b (preferably a pair of these portions 24b arranged on opposite sides of the aforesaid operating portion 24a) having a greater width than the collar 35 so as to enable the insertion of the collar 35 through the first body 13.

Advantageously, the first body 13 and/or the second body 14 have a symmetrical structure with respect to a respective plane of symmetry arranged perpendicular to the axis of rotation "A". Thus, the adjustment device and the hinge containing the latter can be mounted in two positions rotated of 180°.
The invention achieves the aims set forth and attains important advantages.

As was said before, in order to adjust the door leaf with respect to the frame, the adjustment device accord= ing to the present invention enables to actuate appropriate control elements arranged along separate directions parallel to the separate directions of the various adjustments to be made. This makes the adjustment device and the hidden hinge according to the present invention easier and more intuitive in use.
The adjustment is far more accurate since it is possible to make given shifts of the door leaf by broad screw rotations. Thus, a small shift is comfortably obtained with a broad screw rotation.

claim.claim-text: Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 1, wobei der zweite Körper (14) einstückig mit der Trägerplatte (10) hergestellt ist.

Vorrichtung nach einem der vorangehenden Ansprüche, wobei das erste Gewindeloch (20) an der zweiten Wand (29) des zweiten Körpers (14) erhalten ist, während das zweite Gewindeloch (21) an der ersten Wand (28) des zweiten Körpers (14) erhalten ist, und wobei die erste (18) und die zweite Schraube (19) mithilfe der jeweiligen gewindelosen Schlitze (24) den ersten Körper (13) durchlaufen und am ersten (20) und am zweiten Loch (21) an den zweiten Körper (14) angeschraubt sind.

Vorrichtung nach einem der vorangehenden Ansprüche, wobei der erste Körper (13) eine zusätzliche zweite Wand (26') umfasst, die an der gegenüberliegenden Seite parallel zur zweiten Wand (26) angeordnet ist und in ähnlicher Weise mit der ersten Wand (25) gemäß einer Symmetrieebene, die lotrecht zur Scharnierachse "A" ist, verbunden ist, wobei die Tafel (27) ferner mit der zusätzlichen zweiten Wand (26') verbunden ist und die zusätzliche zweite Wand (26') zudem den Hohlraum (36) definiert.

Vorrichtung nach einem der vorangehenden Ansprüche, wobei der zweite Körper (14) eine zusätzliche zweite Wand (29') umfasst, die an der gegenüberliegenden Seite parallel zur zweiten Wand (29) angeordnet ist und in ähnlicher Weise mit der ersten Wand (28) gemäß einer Symmetrieebene, die lotrecht zur Scharnierachse "A" ist, verbunden ist, wobei die Tafel (30) ferner mit der zusätzlichen zweiten Wand (29') verbunden ist.

Vorrichtung nach den Ansprüchen 4 und 5, wobei die zusätzliche zweite Wand (29') des zweiten Körpers (14) der zusätzlichen zweiten Wand (26') des ersten Körpers (13) zugewandt und im Wesentlichen parallel zu ihr liegt, und wobei ein Schlitz (24), der gänzlich identisch zum Schlitz (24) der zweiten Wand (26) ist, an der zusätzlichen zweiten Wand (26') des ersten Körpers (13) erhalten ist und ein zusätzliches erstes Gewindeloch (20') an der zusätzlichen zweiten Wand (29') des zweiten Körpers (14) erhalten ist.

Vorrichtung nach einem der vorangehenden Ansprüche, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass sie ferner Blockiermittel (31) zum permanenten Fixieren einer relativen Position des zweiten Körpers (14) in Bezug auf den ersten Körper (13) umfasst.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 7, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Blockiermittel (31) einen Bolzen (32) umfassen, der am zweiten Körper (14) angeschraubt ist, sodass eine Tafel (30) des zweiten Körpers (14) in Kontakt mit einer Tafel (27) des ersten Körpers (13) bleibt.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 8, wobei der Bolzen (32) einen zusätzlichen Schlitz (33) durchläuft, der in der Tafel (27) des ersten Körpers (13) erhalten ist, und in eine Gewindeöffnung (34) geschraubt ist, die in der Tafel (30) des zweiten Körpers (14) erhalten ist.

Vorrichtung nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 9, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die erste (18) oder zweite Schraube (19) einen Bund (35) umfasst, der an einem Schaft (23) der ersten (18) oder zweiten Schraube (19) angeordnet ist; wobei der Bund (35) zwischen dem ersten (13) und dem zweiten Körper (14) und in Kontakt mit dem ersten Körper (13) angeordnet ist, sodass verhindert wird, dass die erste (18) oder zweite Schraube (19) in Bezug auf den ersten Körper (13) teilweise gleitet.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 10, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass mindestens einer der Schlitze (24) einen Betriebsabschnitt (24a) aufweist, dessen Breite kleiner als der Bund (35) ist, und mindestens einen Einführabschnitt (24b), dessen Breite größer als der Bund (35) ist.

Verdecktes Scharnier (2), dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass es einen fixierten Abschnitt (3), der starr an einen Rahmen (4) gebunden sein kann, einen beweglichen Abschnitt (5), der drehbar an den fixierten Abschnitt (3) gebunden ist und an ein Türblatt (6) gebunden sein kann, umfasst, wobei der bewegliche Abschnitt (5) eine Verstellvorrichtung (1) nach einem oder mehreren der Ansprüche 1 bis 11 umfasst.

Verdecktes Scharnier nach dem vorangehenden Anspruch, wobei der bewegliche Abschnitt (5) mit dem fixierten Abschnitt (3) verbunden ist, sodass er um eine Scharnierachse ("A") rotieren kann, wobei das Scharnier (2) einen Rotationsstift (7) umfasst, der den beweglichen Abschnitt (5) mit dem fixierten Abschnitt (3) verbindet, wobei der fixierte Abschnitt (3) zwei L-förmige gefaltete Elemente (8) umfasst, die parallel zueinander angeordnet sind und mithilfe eines aufrecht stehenden Teils (3a) starr aneinander gebunden sind, wobei jedes gefaltete Element (8) ein jeweiliges Loch (9) zum festen Verkuppeln des fixierten Abschnitts (3) mit dem Rahmen (4) aufweist, wobei sich das aufrecht stehende Teil (3a) parallel zu einer Scharnierachse ("A") entwickelt, wobei die gefalteten Elemente (8) jeweils eine Zunge (8a) aufweisen, die mit einem weiteren Durchgangsloch zur Aufnahme des Stifts (7) ausgestattet ist, der bewegliche Abschnitt (5) eine Trägerplatte (10) umfasst, die zum starren Befestigen am Türblatt (6) und am Körper (12) vorgesehen ist, wobei die Trägerplatte (10) an den Körper (12) angeschlossen ist und die Vorrichtung (1) mechanisch den Körper (12) mit der Trägerplatte (10) verbindet, wobei diese dazwischen platziert ist.
The device of claim 1 wherein, the second body (14) is made as one piece with the supporting plate (10).

The device according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the first threaded hole (20) is obtained on the second wall (29) of the second body (14), whereas the second threaded hole (21) is obtained on the first wall (28) of the second body (14), and wherein the first (18) and the second screw (19) get through the first body (13) by means of the respective non-threaded slots (24) and are screwed onto the second body (14) on the first (20) and the second hole (21).

The device according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the first body (13) comprises an additional second wall (26') arranged, on the opposite side, parallel to the second wall (26) and similarly connected to the first wall (25) according to a plane of symmetry perpendicular to the hinge axis "A", the panel (27) being further connected to the additional second wall (26') and the additional second wall (26') also defining the hollow (36).

The device according to any of the preceding claims, wherein the second body (14) comprises an additional second wall (29') arranged, on the opposite side, parallel to the second wall (29) and similarly connected to the first wall (28) according to a plane of symmetry perpendicular to the hinge axis "A", the panel (30) being further connected to the additional second wall (29').

The device according to claims 4 and 5, wherein the additional second wall (29') of the second body (14) lies facing and substantially parallel to the additional second wall (26') of the first body (13) and wherein a slot (24) wholly identical to the slot (24) of the second wall (26) is obtained on the additional second wall (26') of the first body (13) and an additional first threaded hole (20') is obtained on the additional second wall (29') of the second body (14).

The device according to any one of the preceding claims, characterized in that it further comprises blocking means (31) for permanently fixing a relative position of said second body (14) with respect to said first body (13).

The device according to claim 7, characterized in that said blocking means (31) comprise a bolt (32) screwed onto said second body (14) so as to keep a panel (30) of said second body (14) in contact with a panel (27) of said first body (13).

The device according to claim 8 wherein the bolt (32) gets through an additional slot (33) obtained in the panel (27) of the first body (13), and screwed into a threaded opening (34) obtained in the panel (30) of the second body (14).

The device according to any one of the claims 1 to 9, characterized in that said first (18) or second screw (19) comprises a collar (35) arranged on a shank (23) of said first (18) or second screw (19); said collar (35) being arranged between said first (13) and said second body (14) and in contact with said first body (13) so as to prevent said first (18) or second screw (19) from part sliding with respect to said first body (13).

The device according to claim 10, characterized in that at least one of said slots (24) has an operating portion (24a) whose width is smaller than said collar (35), and at least one inserting portion (24b) whose width is larger than said collar (35).

A hidden hinge (2), characterized in that it comprises a fixed portion (3) which can be stiffly bound to a frame (4), a movable portion (5) which is turnably bound to said fixed portion (3) and can be bound to a door leaf (6), said movable portion (5) comprising an adjustment device (1) according to one or more of the claims 1 to 11.

The hidden hinge according to the preceding claim wherein the movable portion (5) is connected to the fixed portion (3) so that it can rotate around a hinge axis ("A"), the hinge (2) comprising a rotation stud (7) connecting the movable portion (5) to the fixed portion (3), wherein the fixed portion (3) comprises two L-shaped folded elements (8), which are arranged parallel one to the other and stiffly bound to one another by means of an upright (3a), each folded element (8) having a respective hole (9) for firmly coupling the fixed portion (3) with the frame (4), wherein said upright (3a) develops parallel to a hinge axis ("A"), said folded elements (8) have each a tab (8a) provided with a further through hole for housing said stud (7), the movable portion (5) comprises a supporting plate (10) intended to be stiffly fastened to the door leaf (6) and the body (12), the supporting plate (10) being associated with the body (12) and said device (1) mechanically connecting the body (12) to the supporting plate (10), being placed therebetween.
Dispositif selon la revendication 1, dans lequel le second corps (14) ne forme qu'un seul tenant avec la plaque de support (10).

Dispositif selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel le premier orifice taraudé (20) est réalisé sur la seconde paroi (29) du second corps (14), tandis que le second orifice taraudé (21) est réalisé sur la première paroi (28) du second corps (14), et dans lequel la première (18) et la seconde vis (19) passent à travers le premier corps (13) par le biais de fentes respectives non filetées (24) et sont vissées sur le second corps (14) sur le premier (20) et le second orifice (21).

Dispositif selon les revendications 4 et 5, dans lequel la seconde paroi supplémentaire (29') du second corps (14) se trouve face et substantiellement parallèle à la seconde paroi supplémentaire (26') du premier corps (13) et dans lequel une fente (24) totalement identique à la fente (24) de la seconde paroi (26) est réalisée sur la seconde paroi supplémentaire (26') du premier corps (13) et un premier orifice taraudé supplémentaire (20') est réalisé sur la seconde paroi supplémentaire (29') du second corps (14).

Dispositif selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, caractérisé en ce qu'il comprend de plus des moyens de blocage (31) servant à fixer en permanence une position correspondante dudit second corps (14) par rapport au dit premier corps (13).

Dispositif selon la revendication 7, caractérisé en ce que lesdits moyens de blocage (31) comprennent un écrou (32) vissé sur ledit second corps (14) de manière à maintenir un panneau (30) dudit second corps (14) en contact avec un panneau (27) dudit premier corps (13).

Dispositif selon la revendication 8, dans lequel l'écrou (32) passe par une fente supplémentaire (33) réalisée dans le panneau (27) du premier corps (13) et est vissé à une ouverture filetée (34) réalisée dans le panneau (30) du second corps (14).

Dispositif selon l'une quelconque des revendications de 1 à 9, caractérisé en ce que ladite première (18) ou seconde vis (19) comprend un collier (35) disposé sur une tige (23) de ladite première (18) ou seconde vis (19) ; ledit collier (35) étant disposé entre ledit premier (13) et ledit second corps (14) et en contact avec ledit premier corps (13) de sorte à empêcher lesdites première (18) ou seconde vis (19) de coulisser partiellement par rapport au dit premier corps (13).

Dispositif selon la revendication 10, caractérisé en ce qu'au moins une desdites fentes (24) possède une partie fonctionnelle (24a) dont la largeur est inférieure à celle dudit collier (35), et au moins une partie d'insertion (24b) dont la largeur est plus grande que celle dudit collier (35).

Charnière invisible (2), caractérisée en ce qu'elle comprend une partie fixe (3) pouvant être attachée fermement à un châssis (4), une partie mobile (5) étant attachée en rotation à ladite partie fixe (3) et pouvant être attachée à un vantail (6), ladite partie mobile (5) comprenant un dispositif de réglage (1) selon l'une ou plusieurs des revendications de 1 à 11.

Charnière invisible selon les revendications précédentes, dans laquelle la partie mobile (5) est reliée à la partie fixe (3) de manière à ce qu'elle puisse tourner autour d'un axe de charnière (« A »), la charnière (2) comprenant un goujon de rotation (7) reliant la partie mobile (5) à la partie fixe (3), où la partie fixe (3) comprend deux éléments pliés (8) en forme de « L », étant disposés parallèlement l'un par rapport à l'autre et attachés fermement l'un à l'autre au moyen d'un montant (3a), chaque élément plié (8) disposant d'un orifice (9) respectif pour fermement accoupler la partie fixe (3) au châssis (4), où ledit montant (3a) se développe de façon parallèle à un axe de charnière (« A »), lesdits éléments pliés (8) disposant chacun d'une languette (8a) pourvue d'un autre trou passant servant à loger ledit goujon (7), la partie mobile (5) comprenant une plaque de support (10) destinée à être fermement fixée au vantail (6) et au corps (12), la plaque de support (10) étant associée au corps (12) et ledit dispositif (1) reliant mécaniquement le corps (12) à la plaque de support (10) étant placé entre les deux.
